items.name: NTYPES
items.docs: Number of particle types

items.name: PERIODIC
items.docs: Has to be always enabled for legacy reasons.

items.name: COOLING
items.docs: If COOLING is set, then CoolingOn must equal 1, and vice versa. This is to provide rough assurance that you are running a given parameter file with the correct executable.

items.name: GAMMA
items.docs: Heat capacity ratio. Try 1.4 if unsure.

items.name: ISOTHERM_EQS
items.docs: This special option makes the gas behave like an isothermal gas with equation of state P = c_s^2 rho. The sound-speed c_s is set by the thermal energy per unit mass  in the intial conditions, i.e. c_s^2=u. If the value for u is zero, then the initial gas temperature in the parameter file is used to define the sound speed according to c_s^2= k T/m_p, where m_p is the proton mass.

items.name: NUM_THREADS
items.docs: When using OpenMP, with the given number of threads per MPI task.

items.name: IMPOSE_PINNING
items.docs: Enforce pinning of MPI tasks to cores if MPI does not do it

items.name: IMPOSE_PINNING_OVERRIDE_MODE
items.docs: If pinning is specified, overrides any native pinning set by the native MPI implementation

items.name: VORONOI
items.docs: Voronoi unstructured moving mesh to be used

items.name: SPECIAL_RELATIVITY
items.docs: Special relativistic hydro solver

items.name: SPECIAL_RELATIVITY_HLLC
items.docs: Forces use of Riemann HLLC solver when using GR or SR

items.name: GENERAL_RELATIVITY
items.docs: General relativistic hydro solver

items.name: METRIC_TYPE
items.docs: GR Metric. 1 = Schwarzschild. 2 = Kerr BH, etc.

items.name: ATMOSPHERE_GENERAL_RELATIVITY
items.docs: Applies a simple treatment of atmosphere in GR.

items.name: MHD
items.docs: Master switch for ideal MHD.

items.name: MHD_POWELL
items.docs: Powell div(B) cleaning scheme for magnetohydrodynamics

items.name: MHD_POWELL_LIMIT_TIMESTEP
items.docs: Sets a floor on the timestep based on the Powell technique

items.name: MHD_SEEDFIELD
items.docs: Uniform magnetic seed field of specified orientation and strength set up after reading in IC

items.name: VARIABLE_GAMMA
items.docs: Heat capacity ratio allowed to vary

items.name: RIEMANN_HLL
items.docs: Harten–Lax–van Leer Riemann solver

items.name: RIEMANN_HLLC
items.docs: Harten–Lax–van Leer Contact Riemann solver

items.name: RIEMANN_ROSUNOV
items.docs: TODO: ???

items.name: RIEMANN_HLLD
items.docs: Harten–Lax–van Leer Discontinuity Riemann solver

items.name: RIEMANN_GAMMA
items.docs: Riemann Gamma Solver

items.name: VORONOI_STATIC_MESH
items.docs: Assumes the mesh to be static, i.e. to not change with time. The vertex velocities of all mesh-generating points is set to zero and domain decomposition is disabled.

items.name: REGULARIZE_MESH_CM_DRIFT
items.docs: Move mesh generating point towards center of mass to make cells rounder.

items.name: REGULARIZE_MESH_CM_DRIFT_USE_SOUNDSPEED
items.docs: Limit mesh regularization speed by local sound speed

items.name: REGULARIZE_MESH_FACE_ANGLE
items.docs: Regularises mesh face angles

items.name: OUTPUT_MESH_FACE_ANGLE
items.docs: Outputs the mesh face angles

items.name: FORCE_EQUAL_TIMESTEPS
items.docs: Timestep is global and set by AREPO

items.name: TREE_BASED_TIMESTEPS
items.docs: Non-local timesteps (taking signal speed into account)

items.name: DECOUPLE_TIMESTEPS
items.docs: Allows different timebins for gravity and hydro. use only WITHOUT FORCE_EQUAL_TIMESTEPS

items.name: RUNGE_KUTTA_FULL_UPDATE
items.docs: Refines using an exact Runge Kutta method

items.name: VORONOI_MESHOUTPUT
items.docs: 2D and 3D mesh output

items.name: VORONOI_FREQUENT_IMAGES
items.docs: creates images with frequency 'TimeBetweenImages' given in parameterfile, independent of snapshots

items.name: REFINEMENT_SPLIT_CELLS
items.docs: Cells can be split (increasing resolution) during refinement

items.name: REFINEMENT_MERGE_CELLS
items.docs: Cells can be merged (decreasing resolution) during refinement

items.name: REFINEMENT_VOLUME_LIMIT
items.docs: Limit the volume of cells and the maximum volume difference between neighboring cels

items.name: DEREFINE_GENTLY
items.docs: Prevent derefinement in regions of strong local changes of pressure or density. Cells will only be refined if they temperature of surrounding cells is sufficiently similar (within a factor GENTLE_DEREFINE_FACTOR, which has currently a default value of 1.2).

items.name: MESHRELAX
items.docs: This keeps the mass constant and only regularises the mesh

items.name: MESHRELAX_DENSITY_IN_INPUT
items.docs: Attempts to relax, but I have had lots of numerical problems with this option

items.name: SELFGRAVITY
items.docs: Particles are mutually attracted by their own mass

items.name: HIERARCHICAL_GRAVITY
items.docs: Use hierarchical splitting of the time integration of the gravity

items.name: CELL_CENTER_GRAVITY
items.docs: Uses geometric centers to calculate gravity of cells

items.name: GRAVITY_NOT_PERIODIC
items.docs: Controls whether gravity is periodic or not independently from PERIODIC.

items.name: ALLOW_DIRECT_SUMMATION
items.docs: Performed direct summation instead of tree-based gravity if number of active particles < DIRECT_SUMMATION_THRESHOLD (= 3000 unless specified differently here)

items.name: DIRECTION_SUMMATION_THRESHOLD
items.docs: Try 1000

items.name: EXTERNALGRAVITY
items.docs: master switch for external potential

items.name: COMPUTE_POTENTIAL_ENERGY
items.docs: Seems to just be identical to EVALPOTENTIAL but for backwards compatibility

items.name: NSOFTTYPES
items.docs: Number of different softening values to which the particle types can be mapped. Try 4?

items.name: ADAPTIVE_HYDRO_SOFTENING
items.docs: Adaptive softening of gas cells depending on their size

items.name: NSOFTTYPES_HYDRO
items.docs: Used to override the default value of 64.

items.name: PMGRID
items.docs: Enables particle mesh; number of cells used for grid in each dimension.   This enables the TreePM method, i.e. the long-range force is computed with a PM-algorithm, and the short range force with the tree. The parameter has to be set to the size of the mesh that should be used, e.g. 64, 128, 256, etc. The mesh dimensions need not necessarily be a power of two, but the FFT is fastest for such a choice.  Note: If the simulation is not in a periodic box, then a FFT method for vacuum boundaries is employed, using a mesh with dimension twice that specified by PMGRID. Recommended value for periodic boxes, twice the cube root of the number of dark matter particles, i.e. 512 for a 256^3 simulation.

items.name: ASMTH
items.docs: This can be used to override the value assumed for the scale that defines the long-range/short-range force-split in the TreePM algorithm. The default value is 1.25, in mesh-cells.

items.name: RCUT
items.docs: This can be used to override the maximum radius in which the short-range tree-force is evaluated (in case the TreePM algorithm is used). The default value is 4.5, given in mesh-cells.

items.name: ONLY_PM
items.docs: This option disables the short-range gravitational force calculation by the tree, i.e. the gravitational force only consists of the PM-force. Not recommended.

items.name: ENDIAN_SWAP_ENDIAN_READIC
items.docs: Enable automatic ENDIAN swapping for reading ICs

items.name: CHUNKING
items.docs: will calculated the gravity force in interleaved blocks. This can reduce imbalances in case multiple iterations due to insufficient buffer size need to be done

items.name: DOUBLEPRECISION
items.docs: Mode of double precision: not defined: single; 1: full double precision 2: mixed, 3: mixed, fewer single precisions; unless short of memory, use 1.

items.name: DOUBLEPRECISION_FFTW
items.docs: This enables the use of double precision variables for storing the fields that are processed with the Fourier transforms. If this is set, the code will also then use the double-precision version of FTTW for the PM gravity calculations.

items.name: OUTPUT_IN_DOUBLEPRECISION
items.docs: Snapshots written in double precision

items.name: INPUT_IN_DOUBLEPRECISION
items.docs: ICs in double precision

items.name: NGB_TREE_DOUBLEPRECISION
items.docs: Double precision used for neighbour node extension

items.name: SUBFIND
items.docs: Enables substructure finder

items.name: SAVE_HSML_IN_SNAPSHOT
items.docs: Saves smoothing length in snapshots

items.name: TRACER_FIELD
items.docs: Passive scalar field which is advected in proportion to the fluid mass fluxes

items.name: TRACER_MC
items.docs: Monte carlo tracer. Value specifies particle type

items.name: GENERATE_TRACER_MC_IN_ICS
items.docs: Adds a fixed number of Monte Carlo tracers (value specified in param file)

items.name: TRACER_PARTICLE
items.docs: Velocity field tracer master switch. Value specifies particle type

items.name: GENERATE_TRACER_PARTICLE_IN_ICS
items.docs: Add tracer particles at positions of cell vertices in ICs

items.name: VORONOI_DYNAMIC_UPDATE
items.docs: Keeps track of mesh connectivity, which speeds up mesh construction

items.name: NO_MPI_IN_PLACE
items.docs: TODO: ???

items.name: NO_ISEND_IRECV_IN_DOMAIN
items.docs: TODO: ???

items.name: FIX_PATHSCALE_MPI_STATUS_IGNORE_BUG
items.docs: TODO: ???

items.name: ALLOWEXTRAPARAMS
items.docs: Allows unused parameters in parameter file

items.name: BITS_PER_DIMENSION
items.docs: Peano-Hilbert order

items.name: OVERRIDE_PEANOGRID_WARNING
items.docs: Overrides warning which suggests increasing BITS_PER_DIMENSION

items.name: HAVE_HDF5
items.docs: needed when HDF5 I/O support is desired

items.name: OUTPUT_XDMF
items.docs: writes an .xmf file for each snapshot, which can be read by visit (with the hdf5 snapshot)

items.name: OUTPUTCOOLRATE
items.docs: Outputs the cooling and conduction rate if enabled

items.name: OUTPUT_DIVVEL
items.docs: Output velocity divergence

items.name: OUTPUT_CURLVEL
items.docs: Output velocity curl

items.name: DEBUG
items.docs: Enables core dumps

items.name: HOST_MEMORY_REPORTING
items.docs: Reports after start-up the available system memory by analyzing/proc/meminfo

items.name: EOS_DEGENERATE
items.docs: Master switch for degenerate matter, with primitive quantities found using Helmholtz EOS.

items.name: EOS_COULOMB_CORRECTIONS
items.docs: Applies Coulomb corrections to Helmholtz EOS

items.name: EOS_COULOMB_CORRECTIONS_SMOOTH
items.docs: Applies a Butterworth LPF to smooth corrections

items.name: EOS_NSPECIES
items.docs: Number of degenerate matter species

items.name: RELAXOBJECT
items.docs: Calls the relaxation routine in relaxobject.c

items.name: RELAXOBJECT_COOLING
items.docs: Removes energy from the system until the desired temperature is reached

items.name: RELAXOBJECT_COOLING2
items.docs: used for WD+HeShell relaxation

items.name: RELAXOBJECT_BINARY
items.docs: Attempts to relax a binary system

items.name: RELAX_RUNTIME
items.docs: the runtime is assumed to be 10 times the dynamical or acoustic time

items.name: INSPIRAL
items.docs: Attempts to perform matter inspiral

items.name: PASSIVE_SCALARS
items.docs: number of passive scalar fields advected with fluid (default: 0)

items.name: NUCLEAR_NETWORK
items.docs: Turns on nuclear reactions

items.name: NETWORK_NSE
items.docs: Nuclear reactions are evaluated w.r.t NSE

items.name: NETWORK_PARDISO
items.docs: Nuclear reactions are evaluated w.r.t Pardiso

items.name: NETWORK_SCREENING
items.docs: Applies screening to the network

items.name: REACLIB1
items.docs: Uses network rates specified at https://reaclib.jinaweb.org/

items.name: NUCLEAR_NETWORK_DETONATE
items.docs: TODO: ???

items.name: NUCLEAR_NETWORK_DETONATE_CORE
items.docs: Triggers detonation of core during run

items.name: NUCLEAR_NETWORK_DETONATE_POSITION
items.docs: Sets location of detonation at a certain radius specified by the user in a file

items.name: NUCLEAR_NETWORK_TIMESTEP_LIMITER
items.docs: Limits timestep using a maximum energy difference

items.name: NUCLEAR_NETWORK_LIMIT_COMPOSITION_CHANGE
items.docs: Limits changes in composition below a certain value
